text: Robert Hofstadter (February 5, 1915 – November 17, 1990) was an American physicist. He was the joint winner of the 1961 Nobel Prize in Physics (together with Rudolf Mössbauer) "for his pioneering studies of electron scattering in atomic nuclei and for his consequent discoveries concerning the structure of nucleons". Category:Nobel Prize in Physics winners Category:1915 births Category:1990 deaths Category:American physicists
title: Robert Hofstadter
